 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִנְהָרָה‎</span>] **noun feminine** dub., only plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמִּנְהָרוֺת אֲשֶׁר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בֶּהָרִים‎</span> [[Judg.6.2|Judg 6:2]] (+ <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמְּעָרוֺת‎</span> ***caves***, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמְּצָדוֺת‎</span> ***strong-hold***) — (clearly, si vera lectio, from a check <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נהר‎</span>, but with what meaning? [[BDB#Schu|Schu]]<sup>Job 49</sup> compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [which means ***a place hollowed out by water***], and rend. ***crevices, ravines***, so [[BDB#Thes|Thes]] and others; [[BDB#Ra|Ra]] [[BDB#Ki|Ki]] [[BDB#Wetzst|Wetzst]]<sup>Hauran, 46</sup> think of caves with a ***light***-opening; R. Levi ben Gerson ***beacons***, i.e. towers for fire-signals, [[BDB#GFM|GFM]]; but II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נהר‎</span> late in Hebrew; [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] <span class="bdbLangGreek">τρυμαλίας</span>, [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] ***antra***; [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] thinks <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמְּעָרוֺת‎</span> a gloss explaining <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמִּנ‎</span>).
